_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five qualities of a mendicant ready: Restrained in the code of conduct
Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken
Very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned
The teachings that the mendicant is very: These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end
Describing a spiritual practice that’s totally full and pure
Very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reciting them, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically
The qualities of living with energy rous: Not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities
The four absorptions [an5.110:1.8]: Blissful meditations in the present life
Can be attained when they want
The realization of the mendicant [an5.11: Realize the undefiled freedom of heart
Realize freedom by wisdom in this very life
Live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
